poem:
The Fan's Lament

They shuffle, weightless, 
through virtual corridors,
seeking the grail of a ticket,
as Liam's voice
echoes in the background,
a wavering line,
a string across an ocean,
revealing the truth
in the realm of ones and zeros:
some dreams,
no matter their chords,
remain just out of reach.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Oasis: ‘low availability’ for all dates, warns sale site, as millions queue online for tickets – as it happened 4.17pm BST We’re closing this blog now, with a heartfelt salute to any Oasis fans still battling with the sale sites to secure tickets. Some have been lucky, “We see things they’ll never see,” but for disappointed fans, “Please don’t put your life in the hands, Of a rock ‘n’ roll band, Who’ll throw it all". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
